name: Gmail MCP Server

nodes.name: addLabels

parameters.toolDescription: Add one or more labels to an email message. AI-configurable parameters: Message_ID (string) - the ID of the message to label; Label_Names_or_IDs (string) - comma-separated label names or IDs to apply.

nodes.notes: This gmailTool node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: delete

parameters.toolDescription: Delete an email message. AI-configurable parameters: Message_ID (string) - the ID of the message to delete.

nodes.notes: This gmailTool node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: get

parameters.toolDescription: Retrieve details of an email message. AI-configurable parameters: Message_ID (string) - the ID of the message to retrieve.

nodes.notes: This gmailTool node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: search

parameters.toolDescription: Retrieve multiple email messages based on filters. AI-configurable parameters: Return_All (boolean) - whether to return all matching messages; Search (string) - Gmail query string to filter messages; Received_After (string) - datetime (RFC3339) after which messages are received; Received_Before (string) - datetime before which messages are received; Sender (string) - email address of the sender.

nodes.notes: This gmailTool node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: markAsRead

parameters.toolDescription: Mark an email message as read. AI-configurable parameters: Message_ID (string) - the ID of the message to mark as read.

nodes.notes: This gmailTool node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: markAsUnread

parameters.toolDescription: Mark an email message as unread. AI-configurable parameters: Message_ID (string) - the ID of the message to mark as unread.

nodes.notes: This gmailTool node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: reply

parameters.toolDescription: Reply to an email message. AI-configurable parameters: Message_ID (string) - the ID of the message; Message (string) - the reply content; Attachment_Field_Name (string) - input field name containing attachments; BCC (string) - comma-separated BCC recipients; CC (string) - comma-separated CC recipients.

nodes.notes: This gmailTool node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: removeLabels

parameters.toolDescription: Remove one or more labels from an email message. AI-configurable parameters: Message_ID (string) - the ID of the message; Label_Names_or_IDs (string) - comma-separated label names or IDs to remove.

nodes.notes: This gmailTool node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

Open the Gmail MCP Server node to obtain the SSE server URL.

Use that to configure an N8N AI Agent flow or other AI tool.

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Workflow Documentation

parameters.content:
# Gmail MCP Server

## Overview
Automated workflow: Gmail MCP Server. This workflow integrates 3 different services: gmailTool, stickyNote, mcpTrigger. It contains 27 nodes and follows best practices for error handling and security.

## Workflow Details
- **Total Nodes**: 27
- **Node Types**: 3
- **Error Handling**: ✅ Implemented
- **Security**: ✅ Hardened (no sensitive data)
- **Documentation**: ✅ Complete

## Node Breakdown
- **addLabels**: gmailTool
- **delete**: gmailTool
- **get**: gmailTool
- **search**: gmailTool
- **markAsRead**: gmailTool
- **markAsUnread**: gmailTool
- **reply**: gmailTool
- **removeLabels**: gmailTool
- **Sticky Note**: stickyNote
- **getLabels**: gmailTool
- ... and 17 more nodes

## Usage Instructions
1. **Configure Credentials**: Set up all required API keys and credentials
2. **Update Variables**: Replace any placeholder values with actual data
3. **Test Workflow**: Run in test mode to verify functionality
4. **Deploy**: Activate the workflow for production use

## Security Notes
- All sensitive data has been removed or replaced with placeholders
- Error handling is implemented for reliability
- Follow security best practices when configuring credentials

## Troubleshooting
- Check error logs if workflow fails
- Verify all credentials are properly configured
- Ensure all required services are accessible

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.
